summary: The document, classified under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992, details David L. Christ's role as Chief of TSD/Audio Operations Branch. It highlights his extensive involvement and knowledge in global audio operations, research, and equipment from December 1957, including his access to top-secret information and oversight of personnel and activities within the TSD.
key_findings: David L. Christ possessed comprehensive knowledge of global audio operations and research starting December 1957.
He was familiar with specific equipment and operations related to Staff D and FI.
Christ had complete awareness of audio assets in production and stocked for overseas use.
He maintained Top Secret, Special Intelligence, and 'Q' clearances.
Christ had global knowledge of the locations of all audio technicians under his branch.
His prior position in the Applied Physics Branch of TSD provided him with insights into R&D activities.
As Branch Chief, he was informed about all TSD personnel and had a general understanding of overall activities, including research programs.
His multiple visits to 'Isolation' suggest involvement in highly classified or sensitive operations.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
